coram.label: CORAM
coram.summary: Coram is the first and longest serving charity in the UK. Our work enables us to better understand what works for children and young people, and communicate with those in a position to make a real difference. We use our insight and experience to engage with go
coram.notes: Optional notes for further detail, sources or internal use

dhsc.label: Department of Health and Social Care
dhsc.summary: The Department of Health and Social Care (DHSC) is a UK government department responsible for policy and legislation on health and adult social care in England. It leads on improving health outcomes, public health, social care, and integration across health an
dhsc.notes: DHSC works with arm’s-length bodies including NHS England, the UK Health Security Agency, and the Care Quality Commission. It also collaborates with local authorities and partners on adult social care and health integration.

cafcass.label: Cafcass (Children and Family Court Advisory and Support Service)
cafcass.summary: Cafcass is a national public body in England that represents children’s interests in family court cases. Cafcass Family Court Advisers (FCAs) work with children and families, advise the court on what is in a child’s best interests, and support safe and appropr
cafcass.notes: Cafcass works alongside the family courts and partner agencies, including local authorities, to support decision-making that protects children and promotes their welfare.

hertfordshire_county_council.label: Hertfordshire CC
hertfordshire_county_council.summary: Partner in the Standard Safeguarding Dataset project, contributing to schema development and implementation pilots.
hertfordshire_county_council.notes: Hertfordshire has actively contributed to the design, refinement and testing of the SSD schema. Known for early-stage adoption and feedback across children's social care systems.

futures.label: Futures
futures.summary: Futures is a UK-based digital, data and technology consultancy that works with government and public sector organisations to deliver transformation, system improvement and better outcomes. Its work spans service design, data strategy, digital capability buildi
futures.notes: Futures supports the design and delivery of digital and data-enabled change programmes across public services including local government and health and care sectors.

social_finance.label: Social Finance
social_finance.summary: Social Finance is a national impact finance and advisory nonprofit. We work with the public, private, and social sectors to build innovative partnerships
social_finance.notes: Optional notes for further detail, sources or internal use

ukri.label: UK Research and Innovation
ukri.summary: Innovate UK is the UK’s innovation agency that supports businesses and organisations to develop and realise disruptive innovation. As part of UK Research and Innovation (UKRI), Innovate UK funds, connects and catalyses innovation in science and technology, spa
ukri.notes: Innovate UK operates as the UK’s national innovation agency, providing funding, support, and networks for innovation-driven organisations, and works closely with government, research councils, and industry partners.

impower.label: ImPower
impower.summary: ImPower is a UK consultancy and improvement partner specialising in public services transformation, outcomes improvement and systems change. It works with local authorities, health and care systems, and other partners to design, deliver and embed improvements
impower.notes: ImPower focuses on supporting organisations with evidence-based improvement, outcomes measurement, collaborative design and sustainable systems change.

newton.label: Newton
newton.summary: Newton is a consultancy and improvement organisation that supports public services and organisations to deliver change, improve outcomes, and build capability. It works with partners across sectors to design and implement improvement programmes, often using da
newton.notes: Newton works as an improvement partner, supporting organisations with service transformation, capability building, and delivery of change programmes.

lga.label: Local Government Association
lga.summary: The Local Government Association (LGA) is the national membership body for local authorities in England and Wales. It represents councils, supports improvement and innovation across local government, and provides sector-led support, policy development, and adv
lga.notes: The LGA works closely with councils and partners across public services, including children’s services, social care, and digital transformation.

essex_county_council.label: Essex CC
essex_county_council.summary: Early adopter of the SSD model, involved in the design and practical deployment of the data standard.
essex_county_council.notes: Essex has been an early and active partner in the development of cross-authority data standards and practices, particularly in the application of the Standard Safeguarding Dataset.

csdug.label: CSDUG
csdug.summary: Short summary of the entity or activity
csdug.notes: Optional notes for further detail, sources or internal use

the_access_group.label: The Access Group
the_access_group.summary: The Access Group is a UK technology company providing business management software and services across sectors including education, social care, finance, HR and payroll. Its solutions support organisations in improving efficiency, data management and service d
the_access_group.notes: The Access Group develops and delivers a broad suite of business software solutions tailored to public and private sector needs, including tools used by local authorities and care providers.

nspcc.label: NSPCC (National Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Children)
nspcc.summary: The NSPCC is a UK children’s charity dedicated to preventing abuse and protecting children. It provides services for children and families, including the Childline service, helplines, advice, training and support for professionals, and works to influence polic
nspcc.notes: NSPCC delivers frontline services and national campaigns, works with government and partners to improve child protection policy, and runs the Childline service for children and young people.

childrens_commissioner.label: Children’s Commissioner for England
childrens_commissioner.summary: The Children’s Commissioner for England is an independent statutory advocate for children and young people. The office works to promote the rights, views and interests of children and young people, especially the most vulnerable, by carrying out research, infl
childrens_commissioner.notes: The Children’s Commissioner role was established by the Children Act 2004 and provides independent oversight, advocacy and research to safeguard and promote the views and interests of children and young people in England.

action_for_children.label: Action for Children
action_for_children.summary: Action for Children is a UK charity dedicated to supporting vulnerable children, young people and families. It provides a wide range of services including early help, care leaver support, youth work, family support, foster care, and services for children with
action_for_children.notes: Action for Children delivers direct support and preventative services across the UK, often in partnership with statutory agencies, local authorities, health services, and other charities to improve outcomes for children and families.

knowsley_council.label: Knowsley CC
knowsley_council.summary: Partner in the Standard Safeguarding Dataset project, contributing to schema development and implementation pilots.
knowsley_council.notes: Knowsley has participated in collaborative development of the SSD standard with a focus on practical alignment with local authority systems and operational delivery.

system_c.label: System C
system_c.summary: System C is a UK-based technology company providing digital software and technology services for health, care, education and digital records management. Its solutions are used by NHS trusts, local authorities and health and social care partners to manage clini
system_c.notes: The UK's number-one case management solution, transforming children’s social care through efficient and user-friendly technology.

scie.label: Social Care Institute for Excellence (SCIE)
scie.summary: The Social Care Institute for Excellence (SCIE) is an independent improvement organisation that supports positive change in social care. SCIE collaborates and innovates in social care to improve people’s lives, adults and children, working with a wide range of
scie.notes: SCIE provides guidance, tools, learning resources, and support to improve social care practice and services. It works closely with government, local authorities, providers, and people with lived experience.

barnardos.label: Barnardo’s
barnardos.summary: Barnardo’s is one of the UK’s largest children’s charities. It works to support children, young people and families, particularly those who are vulnerable or at risk. Barnardo’s delivers services across the UK in areas such as children’s social care, fostering
barnardos.notes: Barnardo’s delivers hundreds of services across the UK and works in partnership with local authorities, health services and voluntary organisations to support children and families.

integrated_care_boards.label: Integrated Care Boards (ICBs)
integrated_care_boards.summary: Integrated Care Boards (ICBs) are statutory NHS organisations responsible for planning and funding health services within Integrated Care Systems (ICSs). They work with local authorities and partners to improve population health, reduce inequalities and integr
integrated_care_boards.notes: Integrated Care Boards were established in July 2022 to replace Clinical Commissioning Groups (CCGs). They lead NHS planning and funding within their local Integrated Care Systems and work closely with councils and partners.

data_to_insight.label: Data to Insight
data_to_insight.summary: A sector‑led service for local authority children’s data professionals. Led by LAs, supported by ADCS, DfE, DLUHC, Ofsted. Maintains toolkits, shares best practice, and enables national collaboration (DDSF, RCC, NVEST, PATCh, Standard Safeguarding Dataset).
data_to_insight.notes: Collaboration hub for scalable data improvement work in the public sector, especially children’s services. Known for its open, tool-based approach and partnership with government and local authorities.

persons.name: Alister Herbert
persons.role: Lead Officer for Data to Insight

family_rights_group.label: Family Rights Group
family_rights_group.summary: Family Rights Group (FRG) is a UK charity that supports families involved with children’s social care. It provides information, advice, advocacy and training to parents and carers, campaigns for better policy and practice, and works with professionals to impro
family_rights_group.notes: FRG focuses on supporting families in contact with children’s social care, providing independent advocacy and advice, and influencing policy to improve outcomes for children and families.

adcs.label: Association of Directors of Children's Services (ADCS)
adcs.summary: ADCS is the national leadership membership association in England for Directors of Children’s Services (DCS) and their senior leadership teams in local authorities. It supports sector-led improvement, policy development, research, and collaboration across chil
adcs.notes: ADCS was established in 2007 and represents senior children’s services leaders in English local authorities. It publishes briefings and research, convenes networks, and supports improvement activity across the sector.

department_for_education.label: DfE
department_for_education.summary: UK government department responsible for education and children's services policy.
department_for_education.notes: Central government body overseeing schools, children’s social care, and national education strategy. Leads major reforms and funding programmes across England.

mutual_ventures.label: Mutual Ventures
mutual_ventures.summary: Mutual Ventures is a consultancy and improvement organisation that works with public services to deliver change, transformation and better outcomes. It supports local authorities, health bodies and partners with service redesign, improvement programmes, data-l
mutual_ventures.notes: Mutual Ventures specialises in supporting public service organisations with transformation programmes, improvement work, and delivery of change across complex systems.

lancaster_university.label: Lancaster University
lancaster_university.summary: University with faculty of Social Work.
lancaster_university.notes: Lancaster University is an active research institution in children's social care, with notable contributions from its Centre for Child and Family Justice Research and involvement in national reviews and reform.

dorset_council.label: Dorset Council
dorset_council.summary: Dorset Council is a unitary local authority in England. It delivers local government services across Dorset, and statutory provider of all front-line children's social care services.
dorset_council.notes: Dorset Council became the unitary authority on 1 April 2019, replacing the former Dorset County Council and the previous district councils in its area. Children’s services contact information is provided on the council website.

ofsted.label: Ofsted
ofsted.summary: Ofsted (the Office for Standards in Education, Children’s Services and Skills) is the independent inspectorate and regulator for services that provide education and skills for learners of all ages, and for children’s social care in England. Ofsted inspects and
ofsted.notes: Ofsted carries out inspections of local authority children’s services and publishes inspection reports and judgements to support accountability, improvement, and public transparency.

east_sussex_county_council.label: East Sussex County Council – Children’s Services
east_sussex_county_council.summary: The local authority responsible for children’s social care, safeguarding, early help, and family support services across East Sussex. Delivers statutory and preventative services to support children, young people, and families.
east_sussex_county_council.notes: Upper-tier local authority in the South East of England with statutory responsibility for children’s social care and family support. Children’s Services includes safeguarding and child protection, early help, support for children in care and care leavers, fostering and adoption, residential care, kinship care, services for children and young people with special educational needs and disabilities (SEND), and targeted support for families facing financial or social hardship. Works in partnership with health, police, education, and the voluntary sector through the East Sussex Safeguarding Children Partnership (ESSCP).

dsit.label: Department for Science, Innovation and Technology
dsit.summary: The Department for Science, Innovation and Technology (DSIT) is a UK government department responsible for driving science, innovation and technology policy. It supports research and innovation, digital infrastructure, data, and the adoption of new technologie
dsit.notes: DSIT was established in 2023 and leads UK government policy on science, research, innovation, data, and emerging technologies, working closely with delivery partners such as UK Research and Innovation.

adass.label: Association of Directors of Adult Social Services (ADASS)
adass.summary: The Association of Directors of Adult Social Services (ADASS) is the national leadership association for directors of adult social services and their senior colleagues. ADASS supports professional leadership, policy development, sector-led improvement, and col
adass.notes: ADASS provides support, guidance, benchmarking, and improvement networks for adult social care leaders. It engages with government, partners in health, and wider social care stakeholders to influence policy and practice.

ministry_of_justice.label: Ministry of Justice
ministry_of_justice.summary: The Ministry of Justice (MoJ) is a UK government department responsible for the justice system, including courts, prisons, probation services and family justice. It works to protect the public, support victims, and ensure access to justice, including in cases
ministry_of_justice.notes: The Ministry of Justice oversees the family courts and works with partners including Cafcass, local authorities and other agencies to support decisions that protect children and families.

research_in_practice.label: Research in Practice (RiP)
research_in_practice.notes: Optional notes for further detail, sources or internal use

ict_revolution.label: ICT Revolution
ict_revolution.summary: ICT Revolution is a technology supplier that provides digital solutions and services to public sector organisations, including local authorities. Its work focuses on supporting data, digital transformation, and technology delivery within areas such as children
ict_revolution.notes: ICT Revolution operates as a supplier and delivery partner, providing technology and digital services rather than acting as a statutory body or service owner.

ddsf.label: Data and Digital Solutions Fund (DDSF)
ddsf.summary: Funding stream to support local data innovations for children’s services.
ddsf.notes: DDSF was established to help local authorities invest in data infrastructure and innovation. Multiple projects under the DDSF banner contributed to tools such as NVEST, SSD, and RCC.

ffp_programme_guide_2025.label: FFP Programme Guide 2025
ffp_programme_guide_2025.summary: The FFC pathfinder was announced in February 2023 as part of the government’s children’s social care implementation strategy, stable homes, built on love.
ffp_programme_guide_2025.notes: From July 2023 to March 2025, the programme is investing over £45 million to design and test radical reforms in a number of local areas, across the following policies:  family help, child protection, family networks, safeguarding partners. The pathfinder draws on evidence and existing good practice, including from other government programmes: family hubs and start for life, supporting families, reducing parental conflict, strengthening families, protecting children

nvest.label: National Voice for Excellence in Safeguarding Technology
nvest.summary: NVEST is a network for systems managers and social work professionals working to manage, maintain, procure, and improve CMS and other technologies for social work. Funded by Data to Insight and governed by a steering group of LA representatives.
nvest.notes: NVEST is part of Data to Insight's support offer and supports benchmarking, impact tracking, and funding evidence across local authorities.

national_kinship_care_strategy.label: Kinship Care Strategy
national_kinship_care_strategy.summary: First-ever national strategy enabling more children to stay with kinship carers, with £20 million invested to support educational, financial, and practical reforms.
national_kinship_care_strategy.notes: Strategy sets out long-term support for kinship families, including trials of financial allowances, Virtual School Head support, and legal reform pathways. Developed with kinship carers, LA partners, and expert input.

childrens_social_care_national_framework.label: Children's Social Care National Framework
childrens_social_care_national_framework.summary: Statutory guidance on principles, purpose, enablers and intended outcomes for local authority children’s social care in England
childrens_social_care_national_framework.notes: Published by the Department for Education, supported by Ofsted. Updated July 2025.

d2i_apprenticeships.label: D2I Apprenticeships
d2i_apprenticeships.summary: Short summary of entity or activity
d2i_apprenticeships.notes: Optional notes for further detail, sources or internal use

east_sussex_county_council_childrens_ser.label: Special Educational Needs and Disabilities (SEND) Services - East Sussex
east_sussex_county_council_childrens_ser.summary: East Sussex SEND Services provide statutory assessment, planning, and support for children and young people aged 0-25 with special educational needs and disabilities. Information and access to SEND support is primarily provided through the East Sussex Local Of
east_sussex_county_council_childrens_ser.notes: The East Sussex Local Offer is the statutory information service for SEND, providing details of education, health and social care support available for children and young people with special educational needs and disabilities. SEND Services work in partnership with families, schools, health providers, and voluntary organisations, including independent advice services such as Amaze SENDIASS.

fields.scope: Statutory SEND assessment and planning, SEND support services, coordination with education providers, and multi-agency working to support inclusion and positive outcomes for children and young people with SEND.

d2i_excel_toolkit_maintenance.label: D2I Excel Toolkit Maintenance
d2i_excel_toolkit_maintenance.summary: Short summary of entity or activity
d2i_excel_toolkit_maintenance.notes: Optional notes for further detail, sources or internal use

single_point_of_advice.label: Single Point of Advice (SPoA) - East Sussex
single_point_of_advice.summary: The Single Point of Advice (SPoA) provides a single front door for professionals and members of the public to raise concerns about a child or request advice. It triages contacts and directs them to appropriate children’s social care or early help services.

d2i_data_validators.label: D2I Data Validators
d2i_data_validators.summary: Short summary of entity or activity
d2i_data_validators.notes: Optional notes for further detail, sources or internal use

centre_of_excellence.label: Centre of Excellence
centre_of_excellence.summary: Short summary of entity or activity
centre_of_excellence.notes: Optional notes for further detail, sources or internal use

standard_safeguarding_dataset.label: Standard Safeguarding Dataset (SSD)
standard_safeguarding_dataset.summary: A Department for Education-funded initiative led by Data to Insight, working with Hertfordshire CC, Essex CC, Knowsley Council and North West ADCS to create a standardised dataset for children’s social care data sharing and outcomes tracking. Based on the SSD
standard_safeguarding_dataset.notes:
SSD defines a common schema layered on local authority systems. Open-source schema maintained via public repository and updated through partner feedback and implementation experience. 
access_url: https://www.datatoinsight.org/publications-1/standard-safeguarding-dataset---final-report

fields.scope: To create a nationally consistent dataset for safeguarding data collection and use across local authorities, with a focus on interoperability, transparency and analytics.

nvest1.label: NVEST1
nvest1.summary: National Voice for Excellence in Safeguarding Tech. Co-designed with Data to Insight, the LA-owned service for CSC data professionals, NVEST is chaired by Essex County Council with the assistance of independent consultants Ida Cohen and Pippa Barker, who have

childrens_wellbeing_schools_bill_2024_25.label: Children's Wellbeing and Schools Bill 2024–25
childrens_wellbeing_schools_bill_2024_25.summary: Legislation covering safeguarding, support for children in or leaving care, regulation of care workers, breakfast clubs, attendance, and more.
childrens_wellbeing_schools_bill_2024_25.notes: Introduced in Parliament December 2024. Proposes statutory measures related to children's welfare, education provision, and system-wide safeguarding responsibilities.

childrens_social_care_in_england_2025.label: Methodology Report Children's Social Care in England 2025
childrens_social_care_in_england_2025.summary: Quality and methodology documentation supporting Ofsted's annual data publication on children's social care providers, inspections and outcomes in England.
childrens_social_care_in_england_2025.notes: This methodology report accompanies Ofsted’s annual release of data and findings. It outlines data sources, inspection processes, and interpretation guidance for national statistics users.

childrens_social_care_review.label: Children's Social Care Review
childrens_social_care_review.summary: An independent review commissioned by the Department for Education to evaluate the state of children's social care in England and propose system-wide reforms to improve outcomes for children and families.
childrens_social_care_review.notes: Led by Josh MacAlister, with contributions from Karen Broadhurst and others. The review informed major reform proposals including the National Framework and investment priorities.

nvest3.label: NVEST3 | Tbc
nvest3.summary: National Voice for Excellence in Safeguarding Tech.

nvest2.label: NVEST2 | Families First CMS challenges
nvest2.summary: National Voice for Excellence in Safeguarding Tech. Co-designed with Data to Insight, the LA-owned service for CSC data professionals, NVEST is chaired by Essex County Council with the assistance of independent consultants Ida Cohen and Pippa Barker, who have

keeping_children_safe_in_education_2025.label: Keeping Children Safe in Education 2025
keeping_children_safe_in_education_2025.summary: Statutory guidance for schools to safeguard and promote welfare of children under Section 175 of the Education Act 2002

ddsf2a_social_workers_and_cms_constraint.label: Research DDSF2a social workers and CMS constraints
ddsf2a_social_workers_and_cms_constraint.summary: Short summary of entity or activity
ddsf2a_social_workers_and_cms_constraint.notes: Optional notes for further detail, sources or internal use
